[h1]Rating: 9/10[/h1]

It's safe to say I've invested countless hours in this classic masterpiece. From Jailbreak to Deathrun, and everything in between, this game has provided me with endless entertainment and unforgettable memories.

Jailbreak was an absolute blast, and completing tasks with friends made it even better. Deathrun was my go-to when I needed to kill time. Deathmatch served as the perfect playground.

As for Surf, Bhop, and Longjump, I must admit I wasn't the best, but it was always fun to try and improve. However, my absolute favorite mode was Zombie mode. The thrill of being a survivor or transforming into a zombie provided some intense moments.

I can't help but wonder how many brave souls fell victim to viruses in the process of downloading stuff from the servers.

On a nostalgic note, I fondly remember watching Pro Leagues and rooting for NAVI, and their star player, markeloff. I wonder what he's up to these days, but regardless, Counter-Strike 1.6 will forever hold a special place in my memories. This classic gem is a must-play for any FPS enthusiast.
If you're thinking about buying this, You should, nothing like a wave of good memories!

I'm a 40-year-old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game.

I am a single dad to my son, who is now 10 years old. My son recently started playing CS.
In less than a week he has already played over 8 hours.

It was awful for me because it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son.
Because he was always with his friends or watching YouTube videos.

So I decided to create a Steam account to play with my son. I started playing, but it was my first time playing a video game since the 90s, so I was pretty lost. I asked my son for help and we spent a few hours playing the game together.
I enjoyed it, as it was the best time I had with my son since my wife died. Playing video games reminded me that there is fun in everything, and it brought me and my son back together, and now we actually spend time together outside of the house.

Counter-Strike holds a special place in my heart, being both a curse and my primary hobby when I was a kid. Over the years, I've poured thousands upon thousands of hours into this iconic game, making it an integral part of my childhood and a constant source of nostalgia. Whenever I hear "CS," memories of countless nights spent competing with friends and striving for greatness flood my mind.

CS's legacy in ESports is profound, and it wouldn't be an exaggeration to say that the world of competitive gaming wouldn't be what it is today without this game. Despite the decline of its ESports scene, the game's community remains remarkably vibrant, a testament to its enduring appeal.

However, for newcomers, diving into Counter-Strike can be a daunting endeavor. Mastering the recoil control, honing game sense, and understanding strategic gameplay can take thousands of hours. Moreover, the visuals have not aged gracefully, and the dated graphics might not resonate with today's generation of gamers who are used to more sophisticated visuals.

When I recently revisited the game, I was instantly transported back to my carefree days, filled with dreams of becoming a CS legend. The familiar sounds, the adrenaline-pumping gameplay—it all felt like a warm embrace from the past. However, I also noticed that what once seemed like a gaming masterpiece now feels outdated in some aspects.

Despite my nostalgic fondness, I realized that the game might not be as accessible to newcomers who have never experienced its prime. The gameplay might only truly resonate with those who have cherished memories of playing it back in the day.

Nonetheless, the fact that Counter-Strike has maintained a dedicated and thriving playerbase even after so many years speaks volumes about its lasting impact on the gaming world.

To rekindle the game's allure and draw in new players, an update that enhances its visuals to meet today's standards and perhaps introduces some modern gameplay tweaks would be a welcomed move. By preserving the essence of the classic CS experience while offering a fresh coat of paint, the game could attract a new generation of gamers while continuing to engage its devoted community.

Although recommending CS:GO as an alternative for newcomers seems like a logical choice, it's essential to recognize that the two games differ significantly in terms of gameplay and player experience. Counter-Strike requires a higher level of skill and precision, making it a more punishing and competitive environment. On the other hand, CS:CO (Classic Offensive) could be a promising alternative for new players once it reaches its full development potential.

In conclusion, Counter-Strike remains a cherished relic in the gaming world, a masterpiece that shaped the ESports landscape and left an indelible mark on its players. For those who have lived and breathed CS in its prime, the game will forever hold a special place in their hearts.

It is very different from later installments. 

Shooting, due to internal game logic, requires a lot more of short bursts or even semi-auto then later games however, spraying is still viable at closer ranges. Distinction between main guns is a lot more prominent. AK is shot in semi a lot more than other guns, M4 w/ suppressor attached is easiest to spray and non-suppressed M4 is somewhere in-between.

Movement feels very different from later games as well. Pressing crouch for a brief moment makes you jump for a very small height which, allows you to peak over head level cover for info. Also, you can double-tap for even bigger effect or bind to mousewheel to be able to "bob" continuously as you move making yourself harder to headshot. Usual movement mechanics are different too thus, 1.6 is worth trying at least due to KZ, surf and bhop being unique experience.

Overall, recommended to anyone who played GO/Source/2 at least to familiarize yourself with Counter-Strike's history and, who knows, maybe you like it so much, it becomes your main.

"Having experienced both CSGO and Counter Strike 1.6, I must say that aiming at opponents in Counter Strike 1.6 can be quite a formidable task. The mechanics and precision required to land those crucial shots take time to master. However, it's worth noting that the game has garnered a reputation for its toxic fanbase. It's not uncommon to encounter players who are quick to kick you if they perceive your skills to be lacking.

For newcomers seeking a space to practice and improve their gameplay, Counter Strike 1.6 might not be the most welcoming environment. The competitive nature of the game combined with the presence of experienced players can make it challenging for beginners to find their footing without facing criticism or even outright bullying.

Despite these aspects, Counter Strike 1.6 still holds a certain charm. Its nostalgic graphics and gameplay continue to attract a dedicated community of players who appreciate its classic appeal. If you're willing to brave the potential toxicity and put in the effort to hone your skills, you'll find a game that remains playable and offers its own unique experience, even after all these years.

Counter-Strike, available on Steam, is a legendary multiplayer first-person shooter that has left an indelible mark on the gaming landscape. Developed by Valve Corporation, this timeless title has captured the hearts of players worldwide for its strategic gameplay, intense firefights, and dedicated community. Whether you're a veteran of the series or a newcomer, Counter-Strike offers an adrenaline-pumping experience that continues to stand the test of time.

One of the standout features of Counter-Strike is its emphasis on tactical teamwork and precise gunplay. The game divides players into two teams: terrorists and counter-terrorists, each with distinct objectives. Coordination, communication, and strategic planning are essential for success. The game rewards players who master map knowledge, utilize effective strategies, and showcase skillful aim. The competitive nature of Counter-Strike fosters an immersive and rewarding experience that keeps players coming back for more.

The gunplay in Counter-Strike is exceptionally well-crafted. Each weapon feels distinct, with realistic handling and mechanics. Mastering recoil patterns, understanding weapon behavior, and honing your accuracy become essential for achieving victory. The balance between the various weapon options ensures that no single strategy or loadout dominates the gameplay, promoting diverse playstyles and strategic decision-making.

Counter-Strike's map design is a testament to its excellence. From classic maps like Dust II and Nuke to the wide range of community-created maps available, there's a rich variety to cater to different playstyles and strategies. The layouts are intricately crafted, offering multiple paths, chokepoints, and opportunities for tactical maneuvers. Map knowledge and understanding player dynamics are crucial for gaining the upper hand in engagements, making each round a thrilling and dynamic experience.

The game's longevity can be attributed to its dedicated community and active competitive scene. Counter-Strike boasts a passionate player base that continues to refine their skills, create custom content, and compete in tournaments at both amateur and professional levels. The competitive matchmaking system ensures balanced and challenging matches, fostering a sense of progression and achievement.

Counter-Strike's accessibility is another strength. The game can run on a wide range of systems, allowing players with varying hardware capabilities to participate. It also offers various gameplay modes, including casual matches, competitive ranked play, and community-created mods. This flexibility ensures that players of all skill levels and preferences can find an enjoyable and engaging experience within Counter-Strike.

It's important to note that the learning curve of Counter-Strike can be steep, particularly for newcomers to the series or the first-person shooter genre. The game's emphasis on skill, map knowledge, and teamwork may initially present a challenge. However, with practice and perseverance, the sense of accomplishment derived from mastering the game's mechanics is immensely satisfying.

In conclusion, Counter-Strike stands tall as an iconic multiplayer shooter that has left an undeniable legacy. Its strategic gameplay, precise gunplay, and vibrant community have solidified its position as a staple in the gaming world. Whether you're seeking intense firefights, cooperative teamwork, or competitive matches, Counter-Strike delivers a compelling and enduring experience. Join the ranks, test your skills, and immerse yourself in the heart-pounding action of Counter-Strike.

Counter-Strike 1.6 holds a special place in the hearts of many gamers, and for good reason. Even after all these years, it remains an iconic and timeless first-person shooter that continues to captivate players with its addictive gameplay, intense competition, and strong community.

First and foremost, the gameplay mechanics of Counter-Strike 1.6 are nothing short of exceptional. It strikes the perfect balance between tactical depth and accessibility, making it easy for newcomers to jump in and learn the basics while providing a high skill ceiling that rewards dedicated players. The tight gunplay, realistic weapon handling, and emphasis on teamwork create an exhilarating and strategic experience that has stood the test of time.

One of the defining features of Counter-Strike 1.6 is its vibrant and dedicated community. Even years after its release, you can still find active servers bustling with players from around the world. This thriving community ensures that you'll always find opponents to test your skills against, and the competitive nature of the game fosters a sense of camaraderie and teamwork that few other titles can match.

The map design in Counter-Strike 1.6 is a masterclass in level creation. From the iconic Dust and Dust 2 to the tense and claustrophobic corridors of Nuke, each map is meticulously crafted to offer a unique gameplay experience. The strategic chokepoints, hiding spots, and various routes create a dynamic and ever-evolving battlefield, ensuring that no two matches play out the same way.

Counter-Strike 1.6 also excels in its weapon balance. Each firearm has its own distinct characteristics and serves a specific purpose, encouraging players to experiment with different loadouts and find their preferred playstyle. The game's economy system adds an additional layer of strategy, as managing your resources and making smart purchasing decisions can often be the key to victory.

Furthermore, Counter-Strike 1.6's longevity can be attributed in part to its modding community. The game supports an extensive array of mods, including custom maps, game modes, and player-created content. This constant influx of fresh content ensures that there's always something new and exciting to discover, providing endless hours of entertainment beyond the core gameplay.

Visually, Counter-Strike 1.6 may show its age compared to modern titles, but its art direction and distinctive aesthetic have a charm of their own. The simplicity of the graphics allows for smooth performance even on lower-end systems, ensuring a consistent and enjoyable experience for a wide range of players.

In conclusion, Counter-Strike 1.6 remains an undisputed classic in the first-person shooter genre. Its addictive gameplay, skill-based mechanics, and strong community have cemented its place in gaming history. Whether you're a longtime fan or a newcomer eager to experience the roots of competitive shooters, Counter-Strike 1.6 is an absolute must-play. It's a testament to the enduring brilliance of a game that has brought joy and excitement to countless players worldwide for over two decades.

Counter-Strike 1.6: A Timeless Classic That Shaped the FPS Genre

Rating: ★★★★★

Introduction:
Counter-Strike 1.6, the iconic first-person shooter developed by Valve Corporation, holds a special place in the hearts of gamers worldwide. Released in 2000, this game revolutionized the FPS genre and has since become a benchmark for competitive multiplayer gaming. As a devoted player, I'm here to share my thoughts and celebrate the enduring legacy of Counter-Strike 1.6.

Gameplay and Mechanics:
Counter-Strike 1.6's gameplay is unparalleled, offering a perfect blend of skill, strategy, and teamwork. The game features fast-paced, intense rounds where players assume the roles of either counter-terrorists or terrorists. Each side has unique objectives, such as planting or defusing bombs or rescuing hostages, creating dynamic and adrenaline-fueled gameplay. The tight gunplay mechanics, emphasis on accurate shooting, and recoil control require precision and mastery, making every kill and clutch moment incredibly satisfying.

Map Design and Balance:
Counter-Strike 1.6 boasts a diverse selection of maps, each meticulously crafted for competitive play. The map design strikes a remarkable balance, offering strategic routes, chokepoints, and environmental elements that encourage tactical decision-making. From the iconic Dust II to the tactical Inferno, each map presents unique challenges and opportunities for players to outsmart their opponents. The longevity and popularity of these maps are a testament to their enduring appeal and balanced gameplay.

Community and Competitive Scene:
The Counter-Strike 1.6 community is a vibrant and passionate one, fostering a competitive and tight-knit environment. Whether playing with friends in LAN parties or competing in online leagues, the game's community-driven nature creates a sense of camaraderie and excitement. Counter-Strike 1.6's competitive scene has produced legendary players and unforgettable moments, with professional tournaments and championships drawing massive audiences. The enduring popularity of the game, even after two decades, is a testament to its competitive depth and enduring appeal.

Modding and Customization:
Counter-Strike 1.6's modding and customization capabilities have contributed to its lasting legacy. The game's extensive modding community has developed countless player-created maps, weapon skins, and modifications, enriching the gameplay experience. These mods have not only expanded the game's content but also demonstrated the creativity and dedication of the player base, keeping the community engaged and fostering innovation within the game.

Legacy and Influence:
Counter-Strike 1.6's impact on the gaming industry cannot be overstated. It pioneered the concept of objective-based team gameplay, and its influence can be seen in subsequent FPS titles. The game's focus on skill, precision, and teamwork has shaped the competitive gaming landscape, inspiring countless players to pursue esports careers. Counter-Strike 1.6's enduring legacy continues to be felt in the success of its successors, such as Counter-Strike: Global Offensive.

Conclusion:
Counter-Strike 1.6 stands as a timeless classic that has left an indelible mark on the FPS genre. With its addictive gameplay, strategic depth, and passionate community, the game remains as captivating and enjoyable today as it was at its release. Counter-Strike 1.6 is not just a game; it's a cultural phenomenon that has shaped the landscape of competitive gaming. For fans of FPS and esports, this iconic title is an essential part of gaming history that should not be missed.

I am a 40 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game.

I am a single father for my son who is now 10 years old. My son recently started playing CS 1.6.

In less than a week, he has already played more than 20 hours.

It was terrible for me, because it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son.
because he was always with his friends or watching YouTube videos.

So I decided to create a Steam account to play with my son. I started playing but it was my first time playing a video game since the 90s so I was pretty lost. I asked my son for help and we spent several hours together playing this game.

I liked it as it was the best time I have had with my son since my wife died. Playing video games reminded me that there is fun in everything and it brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside of the house.

Counter-Strike: A Competitive FPS Masterpiece

Counter-Strike is an exceptional first-person shooter (FPS) game that has captured the hearts of millions of players worldwide since its inception. Developed by Valve Corporation, Counter-Strike offers an intense and strategic gameplay experience that is hard to match. In this review, we will explore the key elements that make Counter-Strike a unique and captivating game.

One of the defining features of Counter-Strike is its emphasis on teamwork and tactical gameplay. Unlike many other FPS games, Counter-Strike requires players to work together as a team to achieve objectives. Communication and coordination are vital, as players must strategize, plan their movements, and execute precise manoeuvre’s to outsmart their opponents. The depth of teamwork and strategy in Counter-Strike sets it apart from other games in the genre.

Another standout aspect of Counter-Strike is its realistic and balanced weapon mechanics. The game offers a wide array of weapons, each with its own characteristics and handling. From pistols to sniper rifles, every weapon has its purpose and requires skillful handling to master. Additionally, Counter-Strike's recoil system adds a layer of authenticity, making it essential for players to learn to control their shots. The weapon mechanics in Counter-Strike contribute to the game's skill-based gameplay, rewarding precision and accuracy.

Counter-Strike's competitive scene is another factor that makes it truly exceptional. The game has become a staple in the world of eSports, with professional tournaments drawing in massive audiences and offering substantial prize pools. The highly competitive nature of Counter-Strike pushes players to constantly improve their skills, leading to a vibrant and dedicated community. The thrill of competing against skilled opponents and the prospect of climbing the ranks adds an addictive element to the game.

Furthermore, Counter-Strike boasts a remarkable map design that enhances gameplay diversity. Each map is meticulously crafted, offering a unique layout and distinct tactical possibilities. Whether it's navigating tight corridors in close-quarters combat or strategically positioning oneself for long-range engagements, the maps in Counter-Strike provide endless opportunities for creative strategies and memorable moments. The constant updates and addition of new maps by the developers ensure that the game remains fresh and exciting.

In terms of graphics and audio design, Counter-Strike strikes a balance between visual appeal and performance optimization. While the game may not have the most cutting-edge graphics compared to newer titles, it maintains a clean and timeless aesthetic that doesn't distract from the core gameplay. The sound design, on the other hand, is exceptional, with distinct audio cues that help players locate enemies and plan their next move.

In conclusion, Counter-Strike is a true gem in the FPS genre, offering a thrilling and strategic gameplay experience. Its focus on teamwork, balanced weapon mechanics, competitive scene, map design, and solid audio design set it apart from its competitors. Counter-Strike has stood the test of time and continues to captivate players with its addictive gameplay and vibrant community. Whether you are a seasoned player or new to the game, Counter-Strike is a must-play for anyone seeking an exhilarating and challenging FPS experience.

If you could spare a few bucks, buy it for your friends too, try setting up your own servers together with your own DIscord community and maybe setup LAN play with your friends, that is if they brought a laptop or just hit the internet cafe in your area (if there's one available). Plus, with the full package it includes Condition Zero for those who are interested to try out. For solo play, the OG CS doesn't have one since they removed it years ago, but CZ does have offline bots if you're interested at playing solo.

Counter-Strike - The Game That Defined a Generation of Shooters!

Counter-Strike is an iconic first-person shooter that has left an indelible mark on the gaming industry. As a fan of the series since its inception, I can confidently say that the original Counter-Strike is a game that has stood the test of time and remains a benchmark for multiplayer shooters.

One of the most notable aspects of Counter-Strike is its simplicity. The game pits terrorists against counter-terrorists in intense rounds of tactical gameplay. With limited resources and no respawns, every decision matters. The gameplay is fast-paced, strategic, and incredibly rewarding. The combination of teamwork, skill, and communication required to succeed is what sets Counter-Strike apart from other shooters.

The arsenal of weapons in Counter-Strike is iconic, from the trusty AK-47 to the precise AWP sniper rifle. Each weapon has its unique characteristics, and mastering their use requires practice and skill. The balance of weapons and their realistic recoil patterns add depth to the gameplay, making for thrilling gunfights and satisfying kills.

The maps in Counter-Strike are legendary, with names like Dust, Inferno, and Nuke etched into gaming history. Each map has its own layout, chokepoints, and strategic spots, making for dynamic and ever-changing gameplay. The level design encourages teamwork, communication, and strategic planning, creating a unique and immersive experience with every match.

Counter-Strike's multiplayer community is one of its greatest strengths. The game has fostered a passionate and dedicated player base that spans across the globe. Playing with friends or jumping into a server with strangers, the camaraderie and competitive spirit of the Counter-Strike community are palpable. The game has also spawned a vibrant esports scene, with professional players and tournaments that continue to captivate audiences worldwide.

The graphics and sound in the original Counter-Strike may not be as flashy or realistic as modern games, but they are functional and effective. The focus is on gameplay and mechanics, and Counter-Strike delivers in spades. The game has a timeless appeal that transcends graphics and remains a testament to the power of gameplay and mechanics.

In conclusion, Counter-Strike is a game that has left an indelible mark on the gaming world. Its addictive gameplay, iconic weapons and maps, and vibrant multiplayer community have made it a classic that has stood the test of time. If you're a fan of first-person shooters or looking to experience a game that has defined a generation of shooters, Counter-Strike is a must-play. 5/5 - "A Legendary Classic That Never Gets Old!

[h1]A Game Initiation Teacher for Generations[/h1]
 This is the beginning of the life of countless young FPS games, and it is also the childhood in the hearts of countless people. It has been popular all over the world and is a model of the game industry that is imitated and even copied by subsequent games.  This game has been destined to be extraordinary since it was released. Countless servers have been turned on and off, and countless modules have been made and updated. Today it is still alive, living in an abandoned USB flash drive, living in someone’s memory  Here, live the word of mouth from old players to new players.
 Ten years ago, that ignorant boy first met with it, so he was fortunate enough to travel to every quiet corner of the desert and hear the melodious sound of Italian street corners. Ten years later, his school uniform was changed into a suit, and the years climbed up to his face, but when he double-clicked the black and white icon and returned here, he was still the brave boy back then.
 And it will never change.

 An eternal monument should not be judged.

This game is one of the legendary entertainments of the beginning of the 2000s. Amongst several Half-Life's offsprings created after the main game, this is the most successful one. As a multiplayer Half-Life-based game designed with its own unique gameplay like Team Fortress and Day of Defeat, it had surprisingly become extremely popular amongst local area network gaming, which preceded internet gaming at the time, for several years. Its gameplay, character/weapon style, and rules just hit the spot and gained popularity, of which other fellow offsprings could not achieve.

-(Only played CSGO before this)-(play consoles primarily so maybe i just suck)-(potato internet)-(usually run 0-10 deaths and 15+kills playing other MP games)-(ran 25-40 deaths and 10-20 kills in the 3 matches i played this) - Some of the spawns are complete garbage. The spreads on guns are ridiculous even after analyzing recoil patterns and burst firing. Too many variables to consider when it comes to firefights, that aren't explained at all, to even know if it was your fault you died or if you just got hit by lag. This is one of those games im sure runs flawless over LAN or with an optimal internet connection but is really frustrating(because its impossible to tell if its a user error) to get through when your aiming at an enemies head, fire, and the bullet goes completely off course(unless its a sniper). Considering range and the weapon, at optimal range the second bullet in a burst could be an inch off to 5ft away from where you were aiming. When playing this i feel like a nerd with no upper body strength or cardio who always misses leg day thrown into a battlefield with little to no experience even though i have fired multiple weapons in real life. Feels like a bit too much is up to luck to fully enjoy but i do like how chaotic it is and thats enough to keep me coming back for a random MP match here or there. Servers are very active for a game with this age. With all that said i haven't played a "traditional" hostage match yet just TDM and FFA but everything feels surprisingly slow and inaccurate, when im not immediately dying, which may work for sloower, traditional, more strategic based modes where you have the time and space to react in a controlled manner while coordinating with other team mates but feels like im carrying a sack of potatoes while trying to smoke a blunt playing TDM and FFA. I must hone the irish/russian stoner in me to git gud

Игра сама по себе не плохая, но она плохо сохранилась с точки зрения онлайна, а именно:
- Нет нормальных серверов, в частности ванильных. Практически все сервера накачивают тонну плагинов и форсируют тонну ненужных тебе вещей. Зайдя на один сервер, ты не сможешь вернуть привычное расположение пушки в правом углу. А если я не киберспортсмен, которому не нравится пушка в левом углу, а? Меню теперь это поменять не может и конфиг перезаписывается.
- Из-за того что все сервера не ванильные, как правило это не Counter-Strike. Всё от карт до геймплея меняется до неузнаваемости, порой до неиграбельности при наличии так называемых VIP.
- Мало нормальных русских серверо в таблице и те что есть для школололо с очевидной любовью к модифицированным серверам. Пинг навешивается огромный.

Ah, Counter-Strike. The game that put first-person shooters on the map. The grandfather of all competitive FPS games. And let's not forget about its younger brother, CS:GO. I mean, sure, it's younger and more popular, but can it really compare to the OG? I think not.

Let me tell you, Counter-Strike may be old, but it's like a fine wine. It only gets better with age. The graphics may be outdated, but the gameplay is still top-notch. The guns may not have fancy skins, but they still pack a punch. And don't even get me started on the maps. Dust 2? More like "Dust Too Good"!

But let's talk about CS:GO for a second. Sure, it's got better graphics and fancy skins, but what's the deal with all these newfangled weapons? What's next, a grenade launcher? Come on, now. And don't even get me started on the microtransactions. I don't want to have to take out a second mortgage on my house just to get a cool skin for my AK-47.

In conclusion, Counter-Strike may be old, but it's still got it where it counts. And CS:GO? Well, let's just say it's like that younger brother who's always trying too hard to be cool. Stick to what you know, kid.

[u] If your looking for a review on this game you've came to the wrong place, but if your looking for an amazing beef burrito recipe you've came to the right place! [/u]


 [b] Ingredients: [/b]

 1.    1 pound ground beef

 2.    1 envelope taco seasoning

 3.    1 can (16 ounces) refried beans

 4.    6 flour tortillas (12 inches), warmed

 5.    1 cup shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese

 6.    4 teaspoons canola oil

 7.    Sour cream and salsa


 [b] Instructions: [/b]

 1. In a large cast-iron or other heavy skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain. Stir in taco seasoning; remove from skillet and set aside. Wipe skillet clean. 

 2. In a small saucepan, cook refried beans over medium-low heat until heated through, 2-3 minutes. 

 3. Spoon about 1/3 cup of beans off-center on each tortilla; top with 1/4 cup beef mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Fold sides and ends of tortillas over filling and roll up.

 4. In same skillet over medium-high heat, brown burritos in oil on all sides. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

Counter-Strike (also known as Half-Life: Counter-Strike or Counter-Strike 1.6) is a tactical first-person shooter game developed by Valve. It was initially developed and released as a Half-Life modification by Minh "Gooseman" Le and Jess Cliffe in 1999, before Le and Cliffe were hired and the game's intellectual property acquired. Counter-Strike was released by Valve for Microsoft Windows in 2000, and is the first installment in the Counter-Strike series. Several remakes and ports were released on Xbox, as well as OS X and Linux.

Set in various locations around the globe, players assume the roles of counter-terrorist forces and terrorist militants opposing them. During each round of gameplay, the two teams are tasked with defeating the other by the means of either achieving the map's objectives or eliminating all of the enemy combatants. Each player may customize their arsenal of weapons and accessories at the beginning of every match, with currency being earned after the end of each round.

I am a 55 yo mother, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single mother to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2022 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my husband had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

This game saved my life.

I am 41.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with... The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Counter-Strike (CS) is a series of multiplayer first-person shooter video games, in which teams of terrorists battle to perpetrate an act of terror (bombing, hostage-taking, assassination) and counter-terrorists try to prevent it (bomb defusal, hostage rescue). The series began on Windows in 1999 with the first game, Counter-Strike. It was initially released as a modification ("mod") for Half-Life and designed by Minh "Gooseman" Le and Jess "Cliffe" Cliffe before the rights to the game's intellectual property were acquired by Valve Corporation, the developers of Half-Life.

That original game was followed by Counter-Strike: Condition Zero, developed by Turtle Rock Studios and released in 2004. In November of that year, Counter-Strike: Source was released by Valve. Released eight months after Condition Zero, Source was a remake of the original Counter-Strike and the first in the series to run on Valve's newly created Source engine.[1] The fourth game in the main series, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, was released by Valve in 2012 for Windows, OS X, Xbox 360, and PlayStation 3. Hidden Path Entertainment, who worked on Counter-Strike: Source post-release, helped to develop the game alongside Valve.[2]

There have been several community-made spin-off titles created over the years. These include the Online series, Neo, and Nexon: Zombies.

This is one of the most important games ever made, that defined an entire genre and surprisingly, nowadays people still play it. I recommend you buying it for these reasons.

Gameplay is truly special, since it defined a formula that nowadays still work perfectly: a team formed by terrorists has to plant a bomb and defend it until it explodes, or simply has to eliminate all the enemies. On the other hand there is a team formed by counter-terrorists has to defuse that bomb or eliminate all terrorists. There is a huge selection of weapons such as AK-47, M4, P90, MP5 or AWP. You can also equip yourself with kevlar and a helmet.

Graphically still hold up well. You can notice how old the game is, but who cares for the graphics if it's a frenetic game? 

Price, however, seems kind of overpriced for a game that is two decades old. Yeah, it's multiplayer, is fun, there are many actives players daily, but having some newer games in the franchise, this should be cheaper. My answer? Sales or the Valve pack.

What can I say, this game is legendary. I don't need to write a review because even kids today know all about it. I was a little fat kid back when it came out and I didn't have any money for a 'Gaming PC' but I did have a regular PC and a PS1 instead. My grades kind of sucked so that's as good as it got. I didn't get into CS until source came out and it was light years better.

Would I recommend it? F no, tons of way better games to play instead that are way more interesting. Don't waste your time with this crap unless you're a huge fat nerd like me who spends his Fridays playing obsolete garbage like this. Go play P.U.B.G. or that Fornite crap instead.

Am I mad? All the time.

I am a 88 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 74 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2023 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

The first time I came into contact with Counter-Strike was probably 2009-2010,which is not quite impressive as the fact that I was 5-6 years old at the time.I liked to play every type of sports you can imagine,but of course when you get home,the only thing I was interested in was video games.When I wasn't playing I was watching my older brother playing,that's how I learned about CS.I liked it right away,and from then on,played every freakin day multiple hours a day.I made a lot of friends playing on Public servers,then later on I got on automix servers,clanwars and tbh,was pretty good at it.I enjoyed every minute of it,it was pretty awesome.Then,after 8-9 years playing CS I made the jump to Global Offensive and to be honest with you,it just isn't the same,nothing beats the old classic.I'm still waiting for a game to make me feel like CS did,I don't know maybe it's just the nostalgia...

I live in the American Gardens building on West 81st Street, on the 11th floor.
My name is Patrick Bateman.
I'm 27 years old.

I believe in taking care of myself, in a balanced diet, in a rigorous exercise routine.
In the morning, if my face is a little puffy, I'll put on an icepack while doing my stomach crunches.
I can do a thousand now.
After I remove the icepack, I use a deep-pore cleanser lotion.
In the shower, I use a water-activated gel cleanser.
Then a honey-almond bodyscrub.
And on the face, an exfoliating gel-scrub.
Then I apply an herb mint facial masque,
which I leave on for ten minutes while I prepare the rest of my routine.
I always use an aftershave lotion with little or no alcohol,
because alcohol dries your face out and makes you look older.
Then moisturizer, then an anti-aging eye balm, followed by a final moisturizing protective lotion.

There is an idea of a Patrick Bateman.
Some kind of abstraction, but there is no real me.
Only an entity-- something illusory.
And though I can hide my cold gaze...
and you can shake my hand and feel flesh gripping yours...
and maybe you can even sense our life styles are probably comparable,
I simply am not there.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn.
Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.
